summary: Email correspondence between a prosecutor and a defense attorney regarding scheduling an attorney proffer for one of the attorney's clients, an Epstein accuser, following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest. The prosecutor requests complaints and client names to coordinate and avoid contacting represented individuals.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the arrest that prompted the accuser's willingness to cooperate with the government.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest prompts accuser cooperation
events.description: Following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest, an Epstein accuser becomes 'ecstatic' and, through their attorney, indicates readiness to help the government.

events.title: Scheduling of attorney proffer discussion
events.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney correspond to schedule an attorney proffer call for later in the week or the following week, after the attorney provides complaints and client names.

keyFacts: A defense attorney representing nine Epstein accusers previously indicated in January 2020 that none were interested in speaking with the Government, but one client's position changed following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.
The prosecutor requests the lawsuits filed on behalf of the attorney's clients and the names of the clients to avoid inadvertently contacting represented individuals.
The planned next step is an attorney proffer, where the defense attorney would discuss relevant details with prosecutors before any client interviews.
The correspondence references a New York Post article dated July 2, 2020, titled 'This Epstein accuser is 'ecstatic' over Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest'.
